post.description:
Post a set of data collected by city resources. Resources may
collect observations about the city environment through sensor
devices, which provide its sensor capabilities, such as
temperature, humidity, to cite a few. It is possible to post
several observed data by time. Thus, the body must specify the
correspondent capability for each observation.

parameters.name: context data
parameters.description: Post several data collected by sensors of a city resource.

temperature.description: The list of observed data for a given resource capability

value.description: the observed value can be of any type

position.description: The list of observed data for a given resource capability

value.description: the observed value can be of any type

post.description:
When you register a resource with actuator capabilities, such as
**illuminate** or **semaphore**, you must subscribe to the platform
to receive notifications whenever an application send a new command
for this resource. We will notify you through a Webhook 
architecture. To do so, you must provide an HTTP server to receive
a POST command with the notification.

capabilities.description: a list with the resource's actuator capabilities that you want to receive notifications about.

url.description: the callback url that we must send the notification when receiving commands related to this subscription.

get.summary: Search for registered resources using different filters
get.description: This endpoint can be used to search for registered resources based on some specific query parameters. One must provide both *lat* and *lon* in order to perform location-based search. In addition, you may also provide the *radius* parameter to enable the platform to search for resources near to the specified point.

parameters.name: capability
parameters.description: filter resources with the specified capability

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: search for resources near to the point defined by *lat* and *lon* parameters considering the *radius* distance in meters from the point

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: filter based on the resource's description

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: filter based the current status of the resource

200.description: The list of resources the match the search filters

get.summary: Get all actuator commands requested to the platform by client applications
get.description:
This endpoint can be used to get the list of actuation commands requested by client applications for resources with actuation capabilities. It is also possible to filter the results by status, uuid of the target resource, and the actuation capability. Actuation commands may have one of the following status:
* pending - the command was received by the platform, but not by the resource yet
* failed - the command could not be sended to the target resource
* processed - the command was processed by the target resource
* rejected - the command was rejected by the target resource, probrably because it does not konw how to process the input

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Parameter to paginate the resources list. By default it returns the 1st page.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Parameter to paginate the resources list. The default value is 40.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by status. This value should be in ['pending', 'failed', 'processed', 'rejected']

post.description:
One may use this endpoint to send commands to underlying city resources. This API allows you to send multiple commands at once rather than perform several requests to change multiple resources. Whenever a command is requested by a client application, it's status is pending. As a result, the response of this endpoint is divided in success commands (which passed in all validations) and failed commands (with validation or input issues).

Actuation commands may have one of the following status:
* pending - the command was received by the platform, but not by the resource yet
* failed - the command could not be sended to the target resource
* processed - the command was processed by the target resource
* rejected - the command was rejected by the target resource, probrably because it does not konw how to process the input

parameters.name: set of commands
parameters.description: The set of commands for city resources.

capabilities.description: a hash with the capabilities and their values

200.description: The list of successful and failed commands
